title: otp-runner manifest.json
description: A manifest for helping run OpenTripPlanner.

buildConfigJSON.description: The raw contents to write to the build-config.json file.

buildGraph.description: If true, run OpenTripPlanner in build mode

buildLogFile.description: The path where the build logs should be written to.

graphObjUrl.description: A url where the graph.obj should be downloaded from for server-only runs. If `uploadGraph` is set to true, this value must be an s3 url that can be uplaoded to.

graphsFolder.description: The folder where the graphs should be stored.

gtfsAndOsmUrls.description: An array of GTFS and OSM urls that should be downloaded.

items.description: Either a url or s3 url.

jarFile.description: The full path to the OTP jar file.

jarUrl.description: A url where the OTP jar can be downloaded from.

routerConfigJSON.description: The raw contents to write to the router-config.json file.

routerName.description: The name of the OTP router.

runServer.description: If true, run OTP as a server.

serverLogFile.description: The file location to write server logs to.

serverStartupTimeoutSeconds.description: The amount of time to wait for a successful server startup before failing.

statusFileLocation.description: The file location to write status updates about this script to.

uploadGraph.description: If true, the graph.obj file will be uploaded after graph build. Note: if this is set to true, graphObjUrl must be defined.
